com.pb.sawdust.util.sql

Class SimpleConnectionPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.sql.SimpleConnectionPool

  • public abstract class SimpleConnectionPool
extends java.lang.Object
    The SimpleConnectionPool class provides a simple pool for use with java.sql.Connections. The pool allows connections to be reused; the Connection.close() method returns the connection to the pool to be reused. The pool allows a specified number of connections to be reused, once that number has been reached, then any request for a connection will block (wait for a connection in the pool to be closed) or return null, depending on the constructor specifications. A previously opened connection will always be used in preference of a new one, when possible. This connection pool is very simple in that it offers no cleanup: stale connections (broken or unused for a long time) cannot be reclaimed nor removed from use.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleConnectionPool(int connectionLimit)
      Constructor specifying the connection limit for a non-blocking pool.
      SimpleConnectionPool(int connectionLimit, boolean blockingPool)
      Constructor specifying the connection limit and whether this pool should block when it is full.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleConnectionPool

        public SimpleConnectionPool(int connectionLimit,
                    boolean blockingPool)
        Constructor specifying the connection limit and whether this pool should block when it is full.
        Parameters:
        connectionLimit - The maximum number of connections this pool can open.
        blockingPool - If true, this pool will block on getConnection() if its connection limit has been reached and all connections are in use; if false, getConnection() will return null.

      • SimpleConnectionPool

        public SimpleConnectionPool(int connectionLimit)
        Constructor specifying the connection limit for a non-blocking pool. This is an alias for SimpleConnectionPool(connectionLimit,false).
        Parameters:
        connectionLimit - The maximum number of connections this pool can open.

    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        protected abstract java.sql.Connection createConnection()
        Create a new connection to be used by this pool.
        Returns:
        a new sql connection for use in this pool.

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Get a connection from this pool. If this pool is non-blocking, then calls to this method when the pool is full (i.e. its connection limit has been reached) and there are no available connections will return null; otherwise it will block waiting for an open connection.
        Returns:
        a connection from this pool, or null if no connections are available and the pool is non-blocking.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the pool is blocking and an InterruptedException is thrown while waiting for a connection.
